definition: many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
lots of money, less work, and close to home/ideal job
pinyin: qian2 duo1 shi4 shao3 li2 jia1 jin4

sentences.english: It is usually husbands who crack the jokes about difficult, interfering mothers-in-law .
sentences.chinese: 女婿们常爱拿难缠多事的丈母娘开开玩笑。

sentences.english: That ends this strange eventful history.
sentences.chinese: 结束了这出奇怪多事的史剧。

sentences.english: I have so much to do.
sentences.chinese: 有那么多事等着我去干。

sentences.english: Zhang Bin has lots of thing to do every day, he never plays.
sentences.chinese: 张斌每天要做好多事，他从不玩。

sentences.english: I had gotten so much done, but often couldn’t see the forest for the trees.
sentences.chinese: 做了那么多事，但总是见树不见林。

sentences.english: Now I think it would be sort of silly after all this time to divorce him.
sentences.chinese: 现在，我认为经历了这么多事再跟他离婚有些傻气。

sentences.english: Luo Tiangang is almost in a tone of command to Linwei not much.
sentences.chinese: 罗天刚几乎是用命令的口吻要林薇不要多事。

sentences.english: Just he knows that you are so numerous matters, you can also obtain to protect to array.
sentences.chinese: 只是他知道您那么多事，您可也得防着点。

definition: talkative/to speak out of turn/to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/rumors fly
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
to look for employment/to pick a quarrel
to bother/to press sb, usu. to do sth/it's a tough job/sorry to bother you (polite, used to thank sb for a favor)
to meddle/to be a "nosy Parker"/to be too inquisitive about other people's business
to bother about/to haggle/to bicker/to argue/plan/stratagem
incorrect variant of 囉嗦|啰嗦[luo1 suo5]
to go to war (idiom)/to make a big fuss over sth
